snippet: Pope Francis called this assembly to reconsider the church’s approach to marriage and family at a time when the very definition of family is changing.

byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO

abstract: Roman Catholic bishops participating on synod on values in Vatican City issue consensus document after weeks of divisive discussions; document opens small amount of room for Pope Francis's more inclusive vision of church, but is worded such that both liberal and conservative wings of church claim victories; statement does not expressly forbid divorced people from taking communion but rejects gay marriage.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Pope Francis called this assembly to reconsider the church’s approach to marriage and family at a time when the very definition of family is changing.

headline.print_headline: Amid Splits, Catholic Bishops Crack Open Door on Divorce
headline.main: Amid Splits, Catholic Bishops Crack Open Door on Divorce
